0.author: Charles Russell Severance
SM
0.body: excellent for beginners, very well described, great understanding grasped and its simple, very simple, but thats what makes it 5 star, is that its for anyone or as the title says pythong for Everybody
0.title: excellent for beginners

1.author: CN
1.body: Extremely basic but Dr. Chuck is so interesting that you never get bored. You can pass the course in a few days with minimum or even no programming knowledge. It's a good starting point for beginners.
1.title: Extremely basic but Dr. Chuck is so interesting

2.author: BU
2.body: Great teacher Chuck and obviously a great course for people just starting out with programming. Well paced. The suggested timings for the assignments were a bit off, I think, but well, that's just me.
2.title: Great teacher Chuck and obviously a great course

3.author: AG
3.body: Very good introduction to basic programming. Very easy for beginners in python who have already some programming background - but still extremely useful to quickly and efficiently learn python basics.
3.title: Very good introduction to basic programming

0.title: Programming for Everybody (Getting Started with Python)

0.author: RM
0.body: This is a great class. I learned / re-learned a ton. The assignments were challenge and left a definite feel of accomplishment. The programming environment and automated grading system were excellent
0.title: This is a great class

1.author: RB
1.body: The course focuses on Java specific implementations of algorithms, so if you're not from a Java background, you would have a little difficulty with the assignments.The course content however is great.
1.title: The course focuses on Java specific implementations of algorithms

2.author: BJ
2.body: Good contents and the logic of the whole course structure is very clear for a novice like me. The weekly homework is also awesome. Would recommend to anyone who wants to learn about computer science.
2.title: Good contents and the logic of the whole course structure is very clear

3.author: RP
3.body: Incredible learning experience. Every programmer in industry should take this course if only to dispel the idea that with the advent of cloud computing exponential algorithms can still ruin your day!
3.title: Incredible learning experience

2.author: Yaakov Chaikin

0.author: SM
0.body: Actually the best online course i hv ever learnt,especially the professor yaakov is quiet outstanding.And a field trip in a online course sounds rare and good!!Thank You Coursera and yakkov for this!!
0.title: Actually the best online course i hv ever learnt

1.author: SW
1.body: This was a really great course, i learned so much, and it was really interesting and very well explained. I will be taking any more courses done by Yaakov! Really excellent course, thank you so much.
1.title: This was a really great course

2.author: YV
2.body: Many thanks to the creators of this course! It was a very solid refresher for me, even though I have spent in web development a few years by now. I thoroughly enjoyed every lesson. Thank you, Yaakov!
2.title: Many thanks to the creators of this course!

3.author: JH
3.body: Very interesting and well presented. It's difficult to address all the different experience levels so some points were (to me) a bit laboured, but overall a useful, informative and enjoyable course.
3.title: Very interesting and well presented

0.author: CM
0.body: Thought the course did a great job of teaching the basics without getting too ahead of itself. All of the sample code was well commented out to explain exactly what the code did which was very helpful
0.title: Thought the course did a great job of teaching the basics

1.author: AA
1.body: The course was for absolute beginners. I also felt that the content was less in comparison to other similar courses. But this introduction will be enough for beginners to explore further on their own.
1.title: The course was for absolute beginners

2.author: CD
2.body: This is an excellent course for the basics in html, css and js I would definitely recommend it to anyone who wanted to build a simple but interactive website using one of the many frameworks available.
2.title: This is an excellent course for the basics in html, css and js

3.author: AL
3.body: Course is well structured and up to date.Also material provided is also excellent.But Jquery and JavaScript should be explained in more detailed.And some realistic website project should be provided.
3.title: Course is well structured and up to date
Responsive Website Basics: Code with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript

0.author: AH
0.body: It was very helpful and I understood things so easily. A beginner in this field will surely be benefited. Also the extra material is very helpful. This helped me take up full stack web development

1.body: It`s a fantastic course for a beginner. I could feel the effort that was put into to make sure people understood. Thank you Coursera, when I become one the greatest, I will remember this beginning.

2.author: AJ
2.body: this was a nice introductory course to get basic knowledge of the vast field of web development. i highly recommend this course for those who want to start their new journey in the field of web-d.

3.author: V
3.body: Good to learn about Web Development. It helped me a lot for learning and developing a site. I like this course and I'll prefer those to choose this course who want to become a web developer

1.author: RB
1.body: This course will provide all basic information of android and it will also help you to understand the fundamental of java which is used in android. It really help me to improve my skills in android
1.title: This course will provide all basic information of android

2.author: SP
2.body: Excellent !! As a beginner I found this course a major kick-start to building a strong base for my Android app skills. A lot of practice needed though, but these videos would keep me going well
2.title: Excellent !!

3.author: TM
3.body: Great content. All the materials are perfectly covered and taught. I just have a huge problem with the peer to peer review system. The amount of plagiarised code I had to flag was annoyingly high

0.body: Its a great course, but I wish things like multiclass classification and regression were also included, also I think there should be more emphasis on different cost functions and their properties etc.
0.title: Its a great course

1.author: JN
1.body: I know this is intended for a broad audience, but I found that the assignments were too easy. Not that they are testing easy material, but that the answers are almost stated directly in the questions
1.title: I know this is intended for a broad audience, but I found that the assignments were too easy

2.author: GC
2.body: I have learnt a lot of tricks with numpy and I believe I have a better understanding of what a NN does. Now it does not look like a black box anymore. I look forward to see what's in the next courses!
2.title: I have learnt a lot of tricks with numpy and I believe I have a better understanding of what a NN does

3.author: LV
3.body: A bit easy (python wise) but maybe that's just a reflection of personal experience / practice. The contest is easy to digest (week to week) and the intuitions are well thought of in their explanation.
3.title: A bit easy (python wise) but maybe that's just a reflection of personal experience / practice

1.body: A great Introductory course by IBM and Coursera to start your career in Data analytics. Learned a lot from this course like what are the skills that are needed in order to become a good data analyst

2.body: Best material so far, I found, for someone who is looking to pursue/transition a career in Data-Driven roles. This will give you a holistic view of the Data-Driven world as a beginner.
